intro: Hybanthus galeottii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit, which resembles a small tomato, is edible and has a tart, tangy flavor. Hybanthus galeottii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and culinary uses.
